info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford County through 345 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Branch, or 7 miles south of Towanda, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Towanda, Wysox, Herrick, Wyalusing, Monroe, New Albany, Monroeton, Sugar Run, Franklindale and South Branch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
